intro: Psoralea foliosa subsp. foliosa, commonly known as the leafy psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
